revised_title: Impact Sensitivity and Ignition Mechanisms of Explosives
tldr: The authors study the behavior of thin layers of solid materials under drop-weight impact using high-speed photographic and pressure-measuring techniques. They discover that explosives ignite due to localized thermal energy or 'hot spots' created by mechanical shock. The study provides a detailed understanding of the physical processes occurring during impact and helps establish a history of the stress and deformation conditions in the layer of material.
